info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 3:20PM EST until January 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. The snow will briefly mix with sleet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Some blowing and drifting snow possible. * WHERE...Southern Herkimer, Montgomery and Schoharie Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and isolated trees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible at times between 1 and 9 am. The snow will change to a wintry mix or sleet and rain in the early afternoon before changing back over to snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
